finished blanket working from a chart when working from a chart you will read all rs row from right b latte brown 1135 to left and all ws row from left to right 1 x 100g for finished blanket fair isle and intarsia techniques c fern green 1207 3 x 100g for finished blanket when working with two or three colours at once the colours not in use should be stranded loosely across the back of the colour being used when stranding the yarn becomes difficult use a separate ball d crimson red 556 of yarn for each colour and twist the yarn about to be used around 2 x 100g for finished blanket the colour just used to link yarns together on the ws to avoid a hole e zesty orange 476 equipment 2 x 100g for finished blanket one pair 4mm uk8/us6 knitting needles one 4mm uk8/us6 100cm long circular needle colourway two cable needle west yorkshire spinners the croft dk two stitch markers a sandvoe 135 2 x 100g for finished blanket gauge 22 sts and 30 row to 10cm measured over stocking stitch b burnside 690 colourwork on 4mm needles or size needed to achieve 1 x 100g for finished blanket stated gauge it is essential to work to the stated gauge to ensure success c greenbank 404 2 x 100g for finished blanket part one 22 sts and 36 row to 10cm measured over waffle stitch on 4mm needles or size needed to achieve stated gauge d skelberry 580 2 x 100g for finished blanket part two 27 sts and 32 row to 10cm measured over honeycomb cable e challister 1019 on 4mm needles or size needed to achieve stated gauge 3 x 100g for finished blanket part three 24 sts and 30 row to 10cm measured over check pattern on 4mm needles or size needed to achieve stated gauge part four 24 sts and 30 row to 10cm measured over vine pattern on 4mm needles or size needed to achieve stated gauge ffoorraaggeerr by picking ** when prompted follow the up loop between last and instructions as directed next stitch and work into up to the double asterisk the back of this loop or within the two
